item.description:

[quote="_ikram, post:5, topic:280315"]Sorry, VPSLAND is the worst to get, they have started to block the 43594 port for TCP, so you will be unable to host with a defult port.

I reccomend www.swvps.com[/quote]
and that is not true…
Hey don’t use UDP portforwarding with 43594 anymore…
TCP is no problem, but you need to add a little code to do something wih the firt bits idk… Lol

item.title: [vps]
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

You use Remote Desktop, they give you an ip / computer name to connect to, a username (usually Administrator) and a password you entered during setup. Download JDK onto it, Upload your server source, Download your server source onto it, then extract the files, and run the batch file, fix the jdk / jre path if necessary, e.g replace Program Files with Program Files (x86) … it has a constant internet connection, no need for port forwarding Then just type the ip into a client and login If you wanna web host with it I recommend you install xampp and set passwords.

Read full topic

item.description:
@yourusername wrote:

[quote=“tobias222, post:2, topic:280315”]www.vpsland.com is quite good.
I’d recommend buying the $34 / month plan at least.
Use the coupon 50PROMO to get half off first month so youre only paying $17 for the first month.

Any questions? Pm me, I’ll reply quicker than their support.[/quote]
I have a question how do i run my server with it?
